app.title: GitFlow Visualizer
app.subtitle: Interactive guide to understanding GitFlow branching model
app.welcomeDescription: Select a workflow below to see an interactive visualization of the GitFlow branching model.

beginner.title: üü¢ Beginner
beginner.description: Learn Git basics step by step

firstFeatureBranch.title: First Feature Branch
firstFeatureBranch.description: Learn the basics: create a branch, make changes, and merge back

saveYourWork.title: Save Your Work
saveYourWork.description: Make multiple commits to save your progress as you work

undoLastCommit.title: Undo Last Commit
undoLastCommit.description: Made a mistake? Learn how to undo and redo your last commit

switchBetweenTasks.title: Switch Between Tasks
switchBetweenTasks.description: Learn to work on multiple things by switching branches

firstPullRequest.title: Your First Pull Request
firstPullRequest.description: The complete workflow: branch ‚Üí commits ‚Üí PR ‚Üí review ‚Üí merge

syncWithTeam.title: Sync with Team
syncWithTeam.description: Pull latest changes from develop and resolve conflicts

codeReviewCycle.title: Code Review Cycle
codeReviewCycle.description: Address PR feedback with additional commits until approved

featureBranchCleanup.title: Feature Branch Cleanup
featureBranchCleanup.description: Squash messy commits into clean history before merge

bugFoundInPR.title: Bug Found in PR
bugFoundInPR.description: QA or reviewer finds a bug during PR - fix and update

parallelWork.title: Parallel Work
parallelWork.description: Two features developed simultaneously - merge order matters

cherryPickFix.title: Cherry Pick Fix
cherryPickFix.description: Apply a specific commit to multiple branches without full merge

rebaseVsMerge.title: Rebase vs Merge
rebaseVsMerge.description: Use interactive rebase for clean, linear history

monorepoRelease.title: Monorepo Release
monorepoRelease.description: Coordinate releases across multiple packages in a monorepo

rollbackStrategy.title: Rollback Strategy
rollbackStrategy.description: Production deploy failed - revert, analyze, and fix properly

branchProtection.title: Branch Protection
branchProtection.description: Enforce code quality with protected branches and required reviews

sprintDevelopment.title: Sprint Development Cycle
sprintDevelopment.description: A complete 2-week sprint with multiple developers working on features

criticalHotfix.title: Critical Production Hotfix
criticalHotfix.description: Production bug discovered - urgent fix needed while features continue

releaseCandidateFlow.title: Release Candidate Flow
releaseCandidateFlow.description: QA testing release candidates, finding bugs, multiple RC iterations

longRunningFeature.title: Long-Running Feature Sync
longRunningFeature.description: Large feature taking 3+ weeks - must sync with develop regularly

trunkBasedDev.title: Trunk-Based Development
trunkBasedDev.description: Modern approach: short-lived branches, frequent integration, feature flags

stagingproductiondeploy.title: Staging & Production Deploy
stagingproductiondeploy.description: Complete deployment workflow: staging ‚Üí test ‚Üí production

rollbackdeployment.title: Rollback Deployment
rollbackdeployment.description: Rollback staging or production to previous version when issues are detected

results.createBranch: You now have a separate workspace called "{branch}". Any changes you make here won't affect other branches until you merge them.
results.commit: Your changes are now saved as a permanent snapshot. Think of it like saving a checkpoint in a game - you can always come back to this point.
results.merge: The code from "{from}" has been combined into "{to}". Both sets of changes now exist together in one place.
results.deleteBranch: The branch "{branch}" has been removed. This is like cleaning up after finishing a task - the work is done and merged.
results.tag: Version "{tag}" is now marked in history. This makes it easy to find and reference this exact point later.
